intro: Bejaria microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved bejaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy in appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in dense inflorescences, and bloom during the warmer months. Bejaria microphylla is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and fragrant blooms.
